means: 在（某物上）作物主标志（尤指表示物主的地址或姓名的首字母）（ personalize的过去式和过去分词 ）
使（某事物）针对个人、带有个人感情或个性化

sentence.Network_en: All the towels were personalized with their initials.
sentence.Network_cn: 所有毛巾上都标有物主姓名的首字母。

sentence.Network_en: Troll's exclusive, personalized luggage is made to our own exacting specifications in heavy-duty PVC/nylon.
sentence.Network_cn: 特罗尔专用的、个性化的行李箱是按照我们自己严格的规格要求用耐用聚氯乙烯/尼龙材料定制的。

sentence.Network_en: Van Gogh developed a taste for personalized brushwork and brilliant, unmixed colours.
sentence.Network_cn: 凡高发展了个性化的笔法及鲜明 、 纯色的品位.

entry.def: If an object is personalized, it is marked with the name or initials of its owner.

example.ex: The clock has easy-to-read numbers and is personalised with the child's name and birth date.
example.tran: 钟表上的数字一目了然，并且标有孩子的姓名和出生日期。

entry.def: If you personalize something, you do or design it specially according to the needs of an individual or to your own needs.

example.ex: Personalising your car has never been cheaper.
example.tran: 定制汽车从来都没这么便宜过。

example.ex: ...an ideal centre for professional men or women who need intensive, personalised French courses.
example.tran: 面向需要个性化法语强化课程的专业人士的理想培训中心

entry.tran: 使（论点、讨论、思想、事情）针对个人；使个人化
entry.def: If you personalize an argument, discussion, idea, or issue, you consider it from the point of view of individual people and their characters or relationships, rather than considering the facts in a general or abstract way.

example.ex: Women tend to personalise rejection more than men...
example.tran: 一旦遭拒，女性比男性更容易将事情个人化。

example.ex: I hope they won't make the mistake of personalising the issue...
example.tran: 我希望他们不要犯对人不对事的错误。

means.word_mean: 1. made for or directed or adjusted to a particular individual;
2. pointedly referring to or concerning a person's individual personality or intimate affairs especially offensively;
